 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אָחֳרָן‎</span> **adjective masculine** ==another== (Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אחרן‎</span> [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>D 11</sup> +; Nabataean, Palmyrene ***id***. ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>212</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]; compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]]; [[Dan.2.44|Dan 2:44]]; [[Dan.3.29|Dan 3:29]]; [[Dan.4.5|Dan 4:5]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]] [[Dan.5.17|Dan 5:17]]; [[Dan.7.24|Dan 7:24]]. The **feminine** ==in use is== <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אָחֳרַי‎</span> (Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אחרה‎</span>, RÉS<sup>246</sup>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Talmud <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אוֺחְרִי‎</span> ([[BDB#Dalm|D]]<sup>§ 20. 5</sup>); compare [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 61, 5</sup> [[BDB#Marti|M]]<sup>§ 87 d</sup> [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>Beitr.51</sup>), [[Dan.2.39|Dan 2:39]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַלְכוּ א‎</span>, v[[Dan.2.39|Dan 2:39]]; [[Dan.7.5|Dan 7:5]]; [[Dan.7.6|Dan 7:6]]; [[Dan.7.8|Dan 7:8]]; [[Dan.7.20|Dan 7:20]].
